meanings.definition: Showing an arrogant or conceited attitude
meanings.sent1: He was the cockiest player on the team, always bragging about his skills.
meanings.sent2: She strutted around the school like she was the cockiest person alive.
meanings.sent3: The cockiest squirrel in the park thought he owned all the acorns.
meanings.sent4: Among the flowers, the sunflower stood tallest, the cockiest of them all.
meanings.sent5: The cockiest cat in the neighborhood would only eat the fanciest food.

meanings.sent1: Even after making a mistake, he remained the cockiest of all the students.
meanings.sent2: Her cockiest smile showed just how sure of herself she was.
meanings.sent3: The cockiest bird in the flock believed it could fly higher than any other.
meanings.sent4: The cockiest tree in the forest reached for the sky with unwavering confidence.
meanings.sent5: In the race, the cockiest runner sprinted ahead with unmatched pride.

meanings.definition: Displaying a superior or boastful manner
meanings.sent1: His cockiest remarks often rubbed people the wrong way.
meanings.sent2: The cockiest student in class always had an answer for everything.
meanings.sent3: The cockiest cloud in the sky thought it was the fluffiest of them all.
meanings.sent4: The cockiest car on the road zoomed past, showing off its speed.
meanings.sent5: The cockiest flower in the garden bloomed brighter than all the rest.
